figure.label: Palace on the Tajus between Aranjuez & TOLEDO

div.ab: At AranjuesAranjuez the houses almost all of one story and very regularly built with very wide streets. Plaistered with a coat of mud, next mortar & then paint. the streets & squares generally right angles. The whole is surrounded with wood & delightful avenues which extend eight or 10 miles in length up & down the TajoTagus, and 3 or 4 in the opposite direction. The palace is very like all the other palaces of Spain. Great staircases of stone, balls pyramids, obeliscs, &c.... The Tagus is cut into 2 streams or runs so naturally as to leave an island for a private garden which is shady & pretty. The Casa de Labrador or gardeners house a folly of King Carlos IV is about a mile distant from the town up the Tajo. the outside is ugly but like everything at Aranjuez surrounded by trees. A moat is made round it with a wooden bridge. Urns of marble &c. The inside is painted & ornamented very prettily. In some parts no expense has been spared. One small room has pilasters covered with arabesques uncommonly well executed in solid gold & Plateriasilver. Every thing is well finished, & the best specimens of Valencia silk & cloth of Gold are seen on almost every wall. The floors are not all good, some indeed of inlaid marble & some of Tiles glazed & prettily painted but many are of brick & of the common kind not baked sufficiently or of bad materials which fill all Spanish rooms with red dust – The imitation of marble in Scagliola is here in the
div.note: Great No of Arabic M.S.S. at Kgs Library Great Number of Arabic Manuscripts at King's Library shewing that there was a great College of Physicians at Toledo –

figure.note: Pen and ink drawing with watercolour: woman on mule with man
Pen and ink plan with watercolour: interior

div.note: We dined at Sir Chas Stuarts Sir Charles Stuart, future 1st Baron Stuart de Rothesay (1779-1845), then on an intelligence-gathering mission to French-occupied Spain (1808-10). Afterwards minister at Lisbon (1810-14). at Aranjuez with Ld. Wm. Bentinck Lord William Bentinck (1774-1839), army officer and later governer-general in India.. Ld Walpole Lord Walpole (Horatio, future 2nd Earl of Orford, 1752-1822), politician. & Sr Thos Graham Sir Thomas Graham, future 1st Baron Lynedoch (1748-1843), army officer.. The last was getting supplies for Sr John MoorsSir John Moore (1761-1809), army officer famous for his retreat to Corunna (and his death at the subsequent Battle of Corunna). Army the others amusing themselves.
Arsenal. Casa de los MarinerosThe Sailors' House, cannon. frigates. real Sailors. sham fights. Kings boat very fine.
Court comes here in April & in dog days goes to La Granja St IldefonsoThe Farm, San Ildefonso thence to the Escurial & in Novr to Madrid. & Prado
